Hi,
 
I have experimented a bit and added log output to the classes CrawlSc=
ope for 1.2 and ClassicScope for 1.4 which I have attached to this mail.
I =
can see that the problem with the difference in the handling of the crawlin=
g depth arises from differences in the path from the seed.
For the URI  htt=
p://www.umwelt-schweiz.ch/buwal/de/ I get the via http://www.umwelt-schweiz=
.ch/ in both 1.2 and 1.4.
But in 1.2 the path from seed is L and in 1.4 it =
is R. This is why the link-hops variable is increased in the first case but=
 not in the second.
This happens at several places as can be seen in the lo=
gs. Again, is this change deliberately wanted or a bug? ...and can I get ar=
ound this somehow?
 
Bye,
Holger
 
-----Urspr=FCngliche Nachricht-----
Von:=
 Holger Stenzhorn 
Gesendet: Donnerstag, 7. Juli 2005 09:54
An: 'archive-cr=
awler@yahoogroups.com'
Betreff: Changes in handling of crawl-depth between =
Heritrix 1.2 and 1.4?


Hi,
 
I have been using Heritrix 1.2 with an order =
file containing the entries

	<integer name=3D"max-link-hops">1</integer>
	=
<integer name=3D"max-trans-hops">1</integer>

and the seed URL http://www.u=
mwelt-schweiz.ch.

The result was that I got a crawl that had a depth of 1 =
which was the desired thing.
But when I switched to Heritrix 1.4 using the =
same order file with the above entries the crawler went to a crawl depth of=
 3.
Is this a bug or a deliberate change? And if the second applies, how ca=
n I restrict the crawler again to depth 1?
 
Bye,
Holger
